newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sintercast slumps on Swedish bourse.
newsitem.headline: Sintercast slumps on Swedish bourse.

text.p: Swedish development company Sintercast AB, a stock in one of three Deutsche Morgan Grenfell funds temporarily suspended earlier this week, crashed in Thursday morning trade.
By 1200 GMT Sintercast had plummeted 49 crowns to 261 crowns on the Swedish bourse in heavy trade with nearly 8,000 shares changing hands. Share trading is normally counted in the hundreds.
Brokers said the share collapsed after it became apparent that Morgan Grenfell was so heavily weighted in Sintercast.
Fears had now arisen that the investment fund might now sell its holding.
Sintercast, a highly speculative stock, has developed a system for casting car engine blocks.
Heavy trading in Sintercast in recent months, largely by Fiba Nordic Securities, had driven the share price to a high of 550 crowns this summer, brokers said.
